snippet: “Uncle Vanya,” a play known as much for its light comic notes as for its sense of woe, has come to the John Drew Theater at Guild Hall in East Hampton.
abstract: Aileen Jacobson reviews Anton Chekov play Uncle Vanya, directed by Stephen Hamilton and starring Hamilton, Fred Melamed and Rachel Feldman, at the John Drew Theater at Guild Hall in East Hampton (Metropolitan/Long Island).
lead_paragraph: “Uncle Vanya,” a play known as much for its light comic notes as for its sense of woe, has come to the John Drew Theater at Guild Hall in East Hampton.

headline.seo: A Review of ‘Uncle Vanya,’ at Guild Hall in East Hampton
headline.main: Finding Comedy in Ailments, Longing and Despair
headline.print_headline: Finding Comedy in Ailments, Longing and Despair
